intro: Poteranthera warmingii, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a striking perennial herb native to China. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with a distinctive white or yellow throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
